DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study test efficacy cultural- , age- gender-focused Human Immunodeficiency Virus ( HIV ) prevention intervention reduce risk behavior among African-American young woman relative general health intervention .
DOC.detailed_description: This study complete extensive formative phase adapt Women 's CoOp intervention specifically address need young out-of-school adolescent African-American female regard knowledge sexually transmit infection ( STIs ) , HIV sexuality , health consequence substance abuse , relationship male , condom communication social support , HIV risk-reduction violence prevention method . During phase , in-depth interview , focus group , pretesting pilot test conduct adapt refine intervention clinical trial . The aim trial : • Evaluate efficacy cultural- , age- , gender-focused intervention ( Young Women 's CoOp ) relative equal attention control nutrition intervention term change behavior ( e.g. , condom use , substance use , violence prevention ) . At study enrollment/baseline , participant complete questionnaire baseline drug pregnancy test , randomize one two program : Young Women 's CoOp Staying Healthy Eating Well ( Nutrition ) —both include 3 individual intervention session 1 group activity . Follow-ups conducted 3-months post-intervention 6-months post-intervention include questionnaire drug testing . The study since complete analysis manuscript preparation underway . Two abstract accept American Public Health Association conference 2012 2013 . The five paper progress publish include : 1 . Efficacy Young Women 's Coop - analysis complete , manuscript draft 2 . Summary qualitative finding interview focus group - publish September 2013 3 . Homelessness abuse- final preparation 4 . Correlates gang affiliation - manuscript complete , CDC clearance obtain , review . 5 . Post intervention social determinant - re-analyses re-write
DOC.criteria: Female Black/AfricanAmerican 1619 year age Have drop school least problem consider drop school , yet complete high school GED program Have graduate high school alternative school , complete General Education Development ( GED ) program Have vaginal sex least past 90 day male partner Have use one follow least past 90 days—alcohol , marijuana , cocaine/crack , heroin , ecstasy , methamphetamine , prescription drug prescribe , illicit substance . Will area next 8 month Has participate previous formative activity study ( e.g. , interview , focus group , pretesting pilot test ) , Not interested come health behavior study Not able attend 4 session 2 follow ups
